page.title: 15Tatefield Hall
page.content: Our local{Manor House}dates back to medieval times,with reported remains of a{Viking Dwelling. { }The house itself is now two storeys high, but at one time had a third, the local story tells of how the lady of the manor wanted to follow fashion, and had the third storey removed. The house incorporates a{medieval {wall,}and when repairs were being carried out, flattened bullets were found in the mortar joints of the exterior walls. These are believed to have been from the time of the{Civil {War,}when there was a garrison at Knaresborough Castle, who raided local houses in search of booty and provisions The Kent family still live there as their ancestors have done before them for well over 150 years
